name: Bigfoot
description: A large, ape-like creature said to inhabit forests.

name: Chupacabra
location: Puerto Rico, Latin America, Southwestern USA
description: A creature reported to drink the blood of livestock, primarily goats.

name: Mothman
description: A winged humanoid with glowing red eyes.

name: Wendigo
description: A malevolent spirit or monster associated with cannibalism and winter.

name: Jersey Devil
description: A kangaroo-like creature with a horse's head, bat wings, and horns.

name: Mapinguari
description: A large, hairy, one-eyed monster.

name: La Llorona
description: A ghostly woman who mourns her drowned children.

name: El Pombero
description: A small, humanoid creature known for its mischievous behavior.
invoqueInstructions: Offer tobacco and alcohol to appease.

name: Encantado
description: A shapeshifting dolphin-like creature, often appearing as a human.

name: Chullachaqui
description: A mythical forest creature that can change shape.

name: Loch Ness Monster
description: A large aquatic creature.

name: Kraken
description: A gigantic sea monster.

name: Banshee
description: A spirit known for its wailing that foretells death.

name: Black Shuck
description: A ghostly black dog seen as an omen of death.

name: Alp
description: A nightmare creature that brings bad dreams.
invoqueInstructions: Place a broom under your pillow to keep it away.

name: Mokele-Mbembe
description: A dinosaur-like creature.

name: Grootslang
description: A monster that is part snake, part elephant.

name: Tokoloshe
description: A small, hairy creature known for its mischievous and malevolent behavior.
invoqueInstructions: Raise your bed on bricks to keep it away.

name: Kongamato
description: A pterosaur-like creature.

name: Adze
location: Ewe folklore, Togo and Ghana, Africa
description: A vampiric creature that can shape-shift into a firefly.

name: Yeti
description: A large, ape-like creature.

name: Ahool
description: A giant bat-like or flying primate creature.

name: Kappa
description: A water-dwelling creature with a water-filled depression on its head.
invoqueInstructions: Bow deeply to make it spill the water on its head.

name: Mongolian Death Worm
description: A worm-like creature capable of spewing acid or generating electric shocks.

name: Manananggal
description: A vampire-like creature that can sever its upper body and grow wings to fly at night.
invoqueInstructions: Use garlic, salt, or holy water to repel it.

name: Bunyip
description: A creature said to lurk in swamps, billabongs, and waterholes.

name: Yowie
description: A large, ape-like creature similar to Bigfoot.

name: Megalania
description: A giant lizard thought to have existed; some believe it may still live in remote areas.

name: Menehune
description: Small, dwarf-like people said to live in forests and mountains.

name: Taniwha
description: Mythical sea monsters, often guardians of bodies of water or landforms.
